p: Maleated rosin-based dithiourea compounds are yellow solids (m.p. 162–216 °C). They can be prepared from maleated rosin acyl chloride, hydrazine and substituted benzoyl isothiocyanates, according to Scheme 43, and using separation methods such as rotary evaporation, recrystallization and column chromatography [ 105]. They can be potentially used as fungicides [ 105].
